snippet: The merger, the latest in a wave of health care tie-ups, would create a company worth $17.6 billion, with combined revenue of $7.2 billion.
abstract: DealBook Online; IMS Health Holdings and Quintiles Transnational Holdings agree to merger, latest in series of health care deals within industry.
lead_paragraph: The merger, the latest in a wave of health care tie-ups, would create a company worth $17.6 billion, with combined revenue of $7.2 billion.

headline.main: Quintiles and IMS Health to Combine in ‘Merger of Equals’
